metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10065 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The ReadVIFFImage function in coders/viff.c in ImageMagick before 7.0.1-0allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) orhave other unspecified impact via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3').
